parametrized_description: The food truck owner allocates funds up to MaxSpendingBudget for purchasing mangos and guavas, with each mango costing CostMango and each guava costing CostGuava. Each mango sold generates a profit of ProfitMango and each guava sold generates a profit of ProfitGuava. The monthly sales of mangos are constrained to be at least MinMangosSold and at most MaxMangosSold. Furthermore, the number of guavas sold is limited to a maximum ratio defined by MaxGuavaToMangoRatio relative to the number of mangos sold. The goal is to determine the optimal quantities of mangos and guavas to sell in order to maximize total profit.

MaxSpendingBudget.description: The maximum amount the owner can spend on mangos and guavas

CostMango.description: The cost to purchase one mango

CostGuava.description: The cost to purchase one guava

ProfitMango.description: The profit earned from selling one mango

ProfitGuava.description: The profit earned from selling one guava

MinMangosSold.description: The minimum number of mangos sold each month

MaxMangosSold.description: The maximum number of mangos sold each month

MaxGuavaToMangoRatio.description: The maximum proportion of guavas sold relative to mangos sold

MangosSold.description: The number of mangos sold each month

GuavasSold.description: The number of guavas sold each month

constraints.description: The total spending on mangos and guavas cannot exceed MaxSpendingBudget.
The number of mangos sold must be at least MinMangosSold and at most MaxMangosSold each month.
The number of guavas sold cannot exceed MaxGuavaToMangoRatio times the number of mangos sold.

objective.description: Total profit is the sum of (ProfitMango multiplied by the number of mangos sold) and (ProfitGuava multiplied by the number of guavas sold). The objective is to maximize the total profit.
